account.note:
I'm a simple and compassionate Citizen of the Earth.

And have been online almost since the internet began with one hope, and message of it.

Most of the things I post are from a personal book of observations on humanity I've been compiling since I was 14, titled "Wisdom, Warning, and Tyranny." With some from a plan to assure and forward humanity titled "A Future of the Brave."

But please be warned that internet searches for me and "Wisdom, Warning, and Tyranny", or "A Future of the Brave" are often misdirected to other, possibly dangerous, websites. And the links are often very sophisticated, even including some of my most popular observations in the results.

I understand that's odd, and given that I'm really no one I'm just as surprised as you.

In any case my old website, and "A Future of the Brave", are found at the most obvious address - http://www.searingtruth.com

Please don't follow any other links unless you know where they lead.

card.title: FACT CHECK: Did the Koch Brothers Buy NPR?
card.description: Did the Koch brothers buy NPR and force the broadcaster to stop covering climate change?

descendants.content:
@InkySchwartz

Search for:
kock brothers influence on npr

There are a number of really good articles but it’s been over a year since I searched for them. The give large amounts of money and they have their people on the board of directors - they first pushed for “both sides-ism” to be *fair* and then they been slowly working on some very clearly right leaning stories what I have noticed in the past was framing thing such that the lack of congress doing anything was because Nancy Polosi killed budget talks things like that.

No talk about how the tax cuts for the rich made budget deficits worse and would have *experts*. One on and say any spending cuts is a good thing because of these *horrendous* budget deficits

Kock made their money on oil and gas - still do

card.title: Tasha (@TashaKostolany@universeodon.com)
card.description:
@InkySchwartz@mastodon.social 

Thread 1/N

Quick caveat: I am not a reporter, much of the information I know about NPR and PBS and Kock Brothers roles in these are from me causally being aware of it from the early 2010s. There is a LOT of information on Kock Industries and where they got their money from Oil and Gas and that they were early Climate Change deniers.

Two years ago I searched for the Kock Brothers influence into NPR and I had a number of good sources. Today having spent  . . . I don't know . .. an hour. I seem to not be able to reproduce those results. This is what I found thus far.

In the early 2010s David Kock made a push to influence change through corporate donations on a broad scope of areas – college boards – changing journalism programs to bothside-sism, Public Radio and Television and other areas.


Thread 1/N
#NPR #PBS #RightWingInfluence #KockIndustries #KockBrothers

descendants.content:
Thread 2/N

Kock may be working on scrubbing their involvement on these activities but lets look at a breif search of what I found.

David Kock has spent billions of dollars in far right funding – they started the Tea Party which later metastasized into the MAGA movement. By 2013 he was sitting on the board of Trustees of WGBH a Boston station that produces large amounts of programming for NPR and PBS

Activists Slam David Koch's Public TV Role
By Kate Sheppard
Oct 9, 2013, 08:33 PM EDT
|https://www.huffpost.com/entry/david-koch-public-tv_n_4073754

the above article says he is on the baord of WGBH – that is what produces a big part of NPR's national programming

What is WGBH Wikipedia
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WGBH_(FM)

Activists turn up heat on WGBH over role of David Koch
By Dru Sefton, Senior Editor | April 8, 2014
https://current.org/2014/04/activists-turn-up-heat-on-wgbh-over-role-of-david-koch/

By Michael Getler
May 25, 2013

https://www.pbs.org/ombudsman/2013/05/david_koch_and_pbs_the_odd_couple.html

David Kock dies in 2019

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Koch_network

Before David Kock dies he steps down from NPR / PBS board (not sure exactly which and where) and a Kock Industries lackey steps in to serve on the board in his place. This is from my memory and I don't remember the name and I would rather not spend the time to find it right now but this gives you a good head start on where I was coming from

card.title: Exclusive: Charles Koch Has Given More Than $5 Billion Of His Stock To Two Nonprofits
card.description: His previously unreported $4.3 billion gift to Believe in People is now the largest publicly disclosed donation to a 501(c)4–a type of nonprofit with fewer restrictions on lobbying and politics than traditional charities.

descendants.content:
@TashaKostolany @GottaLaff

Excellent and thank you for showing that. I do note the focus is almost entirely on Koch and PBS which is well known, but for all the complaints seem to not impact programming.

My cynical take on this is the programming doesn't matter because they can buy judicial and congressional decisions. No proof of that since it is just a feeling.

As for NPR, PRX, & APM yes by being part of WGBH they have access that direction but programming is not touched. Because TV.
